messageBody:
Hi,

Many thanks for your answer.

>
> Are you sure the file myConfig.conf is compile to classes or this
> file is at classpath?Maybe your path 'resources/myConfig.conf' is
> incorrect?
>

Yes, "resources/myConfig.conf" is also standing into my "bin" directory
which contains all my .class files. My "bin" directory is also given
into the classpath during Junit run.

For info, here is how Eclipse launch my testing class (i removed
classpath config for an easier reading):
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner -version 3 -port
58588 -testLoaderClass
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestLoader -classNames
MyTest

It's strange because when i launch my RMI server in a standalone way
(without Junit) everything work as expected (it find resources)...

Any other idea ?

Thanks !
